intro: Plectranthus grosseserratus, commonly known as the rough-leaved plectranthus, is a shrub native to South Africa. It features opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with coarsely serrated margins, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic foliage. Plectranthus grosseserratus prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
